intro: Costularia setacea, commonly known as the hairy costularia, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia and Africa. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its slender, branched stems. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Its leaves are finely divided and covered in fine hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. Costularia setacea is often found in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas.
